Package com.billiards

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.billiards.Ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Ball>
    public class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Ball>
    Represents a ball. Stores a sprite that can be drawn to the screen. Holds the body for the physics engine .Location and velocity can be updated. Can be moved using cursor or method.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static float RADIUS_M
      The radius of the ball in meters (Only for box2D world)
      static float RADIUS_PX
      The ball's radius in pixels
      static float SCALE
      The scale factor for the box2D balls
      static float SCALE_INV
      The reciprocal of the scale

      • Ball

        public Ball​(float initX,
            float initY,
            Billiards billiards,
            java.lang.String fileName,
            com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body body,
            int ballNum,
            com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Sprite shadow,
            com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g3d.ModelInstance instance)
        Constructs the ball with the necessary params
        Parameters:
        initX - initial x coord
        initY - initial y coord
        billiards - main class for accessing methods
        fileName - filename for the shine of the ball
        body - Box2D body for the ball
        ballNum - numerical value of the ball
        shadow - Sprite that represents the shadow of the ball
        instance - 3D model of the ball

        public boolean update()
        Updates the position of the ball, handles friction, interacts with the Box2D body, updates the 3D model, and allows the cue ball to be moveable
        Returns:
        whether or not to remove the ball from the table
